title: [RIDGELINE] Walking the Kiso-ji [Part 1]
content:
Ridgeliners —
Note: Hello all! It’s been a very busy (lots of movement, too much movement) month this past month. More regular Ridgelines incoming.
The Kiso-ji road runs from the edge of Shiojiri in Nagano, in a northeast-southwest direction through a thin valley shunted between stretches of the Japan Alps: the Kiso Mountains, Mount Utsugi, Mount Anbeiji, Mount Surikogi, Mount Okusangi, and more. Down the road slips — through Japan’s rippling middle-earth range of crumpled central peaks.
